Q: What was the primary purpose of the Federalist Papers?
ExpA: To advocate for ratification of the U.S. Constitution
A: The primary purpose was to persuade the people (especially of New York) to support ratification of the new U.S. Constitution by explaining and defending it—showing the inefficacy of the existing Confederation and arguing for a strong, firm Union as a safeguard against domestic faction, insurrection, and foreign influence.
